$interpreted: Joan: Master, he came to save me. Does that mean he likes me? He gave me a rose and said I was captivating.
Joan: I've made him fall for me. Alas! What kind of woman am I~
Joan: Master, what are you doing?
Puggi: Joan...something's not right.
Puggi: Your training is nowhere near complete. As your teacher, I am truly worried that you may not be fit to be my disciple.
Joan: What!?
Joan: What have I done wrong, master?
Puggi: What is the most important thing to consider when dating?
Joan: Love, care...oh, and concern for the other?
Puggi: Wrong. Wrong. Oh, and WRONG! You've got no idea what you're talking about, do you?
Joan: Master Puggi, I want to fall in love oh so bad~~What must I do?
Puggi: The secret to falling in love is...to not desire what you desire.
Joan: Not desire what I desire?
Puggi: In the world of love...the loser is always the one who falls first!
Puggi: If you like something, say you don't like it. Then act indifferent on purpose. The less you notice him, the more he will notice you!
Joan: Eh!? Really?
Puggi: Look. He gives you flowers then just disappears! And look at you. What a mess. You can't get him out of your mind, can you?
Joan: You're right! Yes, yes...don't want what I want...I'm starting to understand.
Puggi: Take out your notebook and take some notes!!
Joan: Yes, master!
Puggi: Very good. I don't teach these secrets to anyone. Besides contradictory desires, you must also make an imaginary rival for your lo——
Edward: My Jo-Jo~~~
Edward:  I never thought I'd run into you here. It must be the hand of fate, bringing us together as we were meant to be.
Puggi: Hey!! Background actor, get off the damn stage!!!! Are you following us? You creep!
Joan: Master, he must love me. Why else would he pretend like it's a coincidence!?
Puggi: Eh, so that's what you think?
Joan: That's what happens in all the stories! It must be true! What should I do?
Puggi: Don't worry. Remember. You. Do. Not. Like. Him. Whatever he says or does, don't promise him anything!
Joan: Got it! Whatever he says, I won't give him a thing!
Edward: Jo-Jo, I've got something I need to talk to you about in private.
Joan: No problem. Bring it on!
Edward: This is for you.
Joan: So many...flowers...
Edward: I saw all these beautiful flowers and couldn't help but think of your radiant smile. I had no choice but to pick them. Do you like them?
Joan: I do~~~
Puggi: You. Do. Not. Like. Them!!!!!!!
Joan: I cannot accept these flowers.
Edward: You don't like them?
Joan: I hate flowers!
Edward: It's no surprise you don't like them. They're nothing compared to your beauty.
Joan: (...I-I-I-I-I'm beautiful...?)
Edward: Do you like...chocolate?
Joan: I love chocolate~~~
Puggi: ...*cough*...*cough*...!!!
Joan: I hate chocolate!!!
Edward: It's no surprise you don't like chocolate. For nothing could ever be as sweet as you.
Joan: (...I-I-I-I-I'm sweet...?)
Edward: Do you like...me?
Joan: I...
Joan: I-I-I-I-I don't like y-y-y-you. Don't you come any closer!
Joan: I-I-I-I've something to attend to. B-B-B-B-Bye~
Joan: (Master! That's far enough, right?)
Joan: (I just rejected him. He must be missing me already. Okay, now just wait for him come to me~)
Joan: Edward...?
Joan: It's been so long. Where's Edward...?
Joan: Where is he!?!? If he really likes me, wouldn't he follow me?
